security_audit.summary: This is a pure content-generation skill with no file access, network calls, or code execution capabilities. The skill generates algorithmic art descriptions and p5.js code templates that run client-side in browsers. No dangerous patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Creating generative art requires both technical skill and artistic vision. This skill guides AI systems to create original algorithmic art with seeded randomness, interactive parameters, and gallery-quality output.
actual_capabilities: Create algorithmic philosophies as foundations for generative art
Build p5.js generative art with seeded randomness for reproducibility
Design interactive parameter controls for real-time exploration
Generate self-contained HTML artifacts with full UI and seed navigation
Implement particle systems, flow fields, and emergent behaviors
Export downloadable PNG files from generated art
limitations: Does not generate raster image files directly - creates HTML/JavaScript code
Requires a browser environment to view generated artifacts
Relies on p5.js library loaded from CDN for rendering
Art quality depends on the AI implementation following craftsmanship guidelines

prompt_templates.title: Flow Field Art
prompt_templates.prompt: Create algorithmic art with a flow field where thousands of particles follow Perlin noise vectors, leaving trails that accumulate into organic density patterns. Include controls for particle count, flow speed, and noise scale.

prompt_templates.title: Geometric Harmony
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate algorithmic art based on harmonic interference patterns. Use grid-initialized particles with phase values that evolve through sine waves. Include color mapping based on interference intensity.

prompt_templates.title: Recursive Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create recursive branching structures using subdivision algorithms. Golden ratios should constrain branch angles. Include noise perturbations for organic feel and diminishing line weights at deeper recursion levels.

prompt_templates.title: Crystal Growth
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement stochastic crystallization with randomized circle packing or Voronoi tessellation. Use relaxation algorithms to evolve cells until equilibrium. Color based on cell size and neighbor count.

output_examples.input: Create algorithmic art about ocean waves
output: Generates: Organic Turbulence philosophy about chaotic flow
Creates: Interactive HTML with particle system responding to noise fields
Includes: Controls for wave intensity, particle count, and color palette
Features: Seed-based reproducibility for consistent variations

best_practices: Always use seeded randomness so the same parameters produce identical results
Design parameters that control algorithmic properties, not just visual appearance
Emphasize emergent behavior and process over static final compositions
Follow the template structure for consistent UI with seed navigation and parameter controls
anti_patterns: Do not use random values without seeds - results should be reproducible
Avoid static templates - each artwork should express its unique algorithmic philosophy
Do not hardcode magic numbers without explaining their purpose in the philosophy
Skip the craftsmanship emphasis - art should feel refined through countless iterations

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for generating p5.js generative art in HTML format.

faq.question: What file formats does it produce?
faq.answer: Creates self-contained HTML files with embedded JavaScript. Works instantly in browsers or as Claude artifacts.

faq.question: Can I use external libraries?
faq.answer: Templates use p5.js from CDN. You can add other client-side libraries but keep artifacts self-contained.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill generates static HTML/JS code. No data is collected, stored, or transmitted beyond loading standard CDN libraries.

faq.question: Why does my art look different each time?
faq.answer: Use seeded randomness with randomSeed() and noiseSeed(). Same seed always produces identical output.

faq.question: How is this different from image generation?
faq.answer: Creates live, interactive code rather than static images. Users can explore parameters and regenerate variations in real time.
